array.string: Genius is another word for magic, and the whole point of magic is that it is inexplicable.
We are magic. It is magic that we're walking around.
Magic never weakened. Magic never hid. Magic always ruled.
The belief in magic...is older in Egypt than the belief in God.
A life of love is one of continual growth, where the doors and windows of experience are always open to the wonder and magic that life offers.
Many secrets of art and nature are thought by the unlearned to be magical.
The greatest magic is transmuting the passions.
Art is magic delivered from the lie of being truth.
You are free only in one sense: free from education in governing your life yourself, free from self-criticism.
See yourself as you really are...Don't run. Have the courage to look at yourself!
Only you yourself can be your liberator!
Don't run away. Don't be afraid. It is not so terrible to be the responsible bearer of human society.
Follow the voice of your heart, even if it leads you off the path of timid souls.
There is only one thing that counts: to live one's life well and happily...
Your life will be good and secure when aliveness means more to you than security.
Love, work, and knowledge are the well-springs of our life. They should also govern it.
Only the liberation of the natural capacity for love in human beings can master their sadistic destructiveness.
Scientific theory is a contrived foothold in the chaos of living phenomena.
On all sides, life is surrounded by hostility.
It is on your thinking and your actions that the future of humanity depends.
Animals outline their territories with their excretions, humans outline their territories by ink excretions on paper.
Whatever the Thinker thinks, the Prover will prove.
Pardon my levity, I don't see how to take death seriously. It seems absurd.
I look forward without dogmatic optimism but without dread.
I remain cheerful and unimpressed.
I love you all and I deeply implore you to keep the lasagna flying.
Each man spills the drink he loves.
I don't know what anything 'is'; I only know how it seems to me at this moment.
'Is,' 'is.' 'is' - the idiocy of the word haunts me. If it were abolished, human thought might begin to make sense.
The fallacy is that one can judge the part in isolation from the whole is 'the Lie that all men believe.'
Out of a meaningless and pointless existence, we have made meaning and purpose...
There is absolutely nothing that can be taken for granted in this world.
We are all absolutely free.
There is no restraint that cannot be escaped.
We live in an age of artificial scarcity, maintained by ignorance and fear.
There are periods of history when the visions of madmen and dope fiends are a better guide to reality than the common-sense interpretation of...the so-called normal mind.
The longer one is alone, the easier it is to hear the song of the earth.
The devil is only a convenient myth invented by the real malefactors of our world.
The Bible tells us to be like God, and then on page after page it describes God as a mass murderer.
ONLY THE MADMAN IS ABSOLUTELY SURE.
Once something becomes discernable, or understandable, we no longer need to repeat it. We can destroy it.
Of course I'm crazy, but that doesn't mean I'm wrong.
Most of our ancestors were not perfect ladies and gentlemen. The majority of them weren't even mammals.
Mind is a tool invented by the universe to see itself; but it can never see all of itself...
It only takes 20 years for a liberal to become a conservative without changing a single idea.
I don't believe anything, but I have many suspicions.
Horror is the natural reaction to the last 5,000 years of history.
Everyone has a belief system, B.S., the trick is to learn not to take anyone's B.S. too seriously, especially your own.
Beyond a certain point, the whole universe becomes a continuous process of initiation.
Belief is the death of intelligence.
A true initiation never ends.
I really dread serious people. Especially serious, dogmatic people.

...in the absence of will power, the most complete collection of virtues and talents is wholly worthless.
It is necessary, in this world, to be made of harder stuff than one's environment.
The ordinary man looking at a mountain is like an illiterate person confronted with a Greek manuscript.
My own plan is to swear off every kind of virtue, so that I triumph even when I fall!
May the New Year bring you courage to break your resolutions early!
Love is the law, love under will.
I've a strange feeling come over me - almost as if I were going to think!

Since all things are God, in all things thou seest just so much of God as thy capacity affordeth thee.

I hardly ever talk - words seem such a waste, and they are none of them true.
What the eye doesn't see, the heart doesn't grieve over.
Every man and every woman is a star.

I've written this to keep from crying. But I am crying, only the tears won't come.

Having to talk destroys the symphony of silence.
Your kiss is bitter with cocaine.

Ordinary morality is only for ordinary people.

Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law.

Cultural legacies are powerful forces. They have deep roots and long lives.

In the act of tearing something apart, you lose its meaning.
Emotion is contagious.

Everything is science and everything is philosophy.
We are caught in a secret history, in a forest of symbols.
The world and I are within one another.
Expression is like a step taken in the fog - no one can say where, if anywhere, it will lead.

The body is our general medium for having a world.

At the heart of all beauty lies something inhuman.
Always go too far, because that's where you'll find the truth.
In order to understand the world, one has to turn away from it on occasion.

People hasten to judge in order not to be judged themselves.
